intro: ^I will retrace my steps now. I will take a deep breath and remember where I left the path I was following then. I am sure I will find what I am looking for there.

s0: ^The trees are kind of dry around here.
s2: ^I do not recognize any rocks here.

c-0: ^I step a bit deeper into the path. The ground is moist, sticky and cold.
c-1: ^Looking around, I notice a few broken twigs and a small trail into the bushes.
c-2: ^I just got back into the path. I am not leaving right now.

b: ^The traces I left around the path will help me find my way. Every once in a while, I will need to re-trace them. I might outline them in the ground, in the bark of a tree, in the palm of my hand.

c-0: ^The cool shade of the trees licks the skin in my arms as I move in.
c-1: ^I need to take a step forward to enter the path.

s0: ^I take a few steps in. There is not a lot to see, it is dense. I try to remember how it felt to come here from the other end. I cannot really recall.
s1: ^I look down every once in a while, but I do not find what I am looking for.
s2: ^I have the impression it is getting a bit warmer here.

c-0: ^Branches cling to my clothes. Stepping forward feels a bit slow somehow?
c-1: ^I scratch at the rocks and lumps of soil near my feet. No success so far.
c-2: ^Breath-in, breath-out. I've been through this before.

b: ^I see a tree stump, one that I have seen before.

s0: ^It was not like this when I passed by back then.
s1: ^I can recognize this land. I stick and drag my nails on its top layer.
s2: ^I am almost there. I can smell it.

c-0: ^I continue ahead, crawling on my knees.

s0: ^I lift some rocks, the gravel looks familiar.
s1: ^So many things have taken place here. They have come and gone.
s2: ^I sense the coming together of water, ground and root.

end_game: ^I stop near a clearing. It feels huge and airy: I can see clouds through the tree canopies. I dig a clump of red dirt with my left hand as I hold on to a small seed in the other. (small pause) I dig some more, the dirt has just the right red hue here. Yes, it will grow and heal. I am satisfied.
